cards.title: Archaeologists unveil 3,500-year-old city in Peru
cards.summary: Archaeologists have announced the discovery of an ancient city in Peru's northern Barranca province. The 3,500-year-old city, named Pe√±ico, is believed to have served as a key trading hub connecting early Pacific coast communities with those living in the Andes mountains and Amazon basin.

cards.title: How tariffs are shifting global supply chains
cards.summary: Donald Trump's 90-day pause on tariffs on Chinese imports is about to expire on Wednesday, 9 July. Many Canadian companies, who often trade in both their home country and in the US, are now facing a double hit to their supply chains.

cards.title: Israel launches strikes on Houthi targets in Yemen
cards.summary: Israel says it has launched strikes on three ports and a power plant in Houthi-controlled Yemen. The attacks on Hudaydah, Ras Isa and Saif ports came shortly after the Israeli military urged civilians in the areas to evacuate, warning of imminent air strikes.

cards.title: Hamas security officer says group has lost control over most of Gaza
cards.summary: Hamas security officer says group has lost 80% of its control over most of Gaza Strip. The officer was wounded in the first week of the war, which began after the Hamas-led attack on Israel on October 2023. He shared several voice messages with the BBC on condition of anonymity.

cards.title: First round of Gaza ceasefire talks ends without breakthrough
cards.summary: First round of Gaza ceasefire talks ends without breakthrough. Palestinian official says Israeli delegation was not "sufficiently authorised" to reach an agreement with Hamas because it had "no real powers"

cards.title: At least 78 dead and dozens missing in Texas floods as more rain looms
cards.summary: At least 78 people have been confirmed dead in central Texas and another 41 are missing. Sixty-eight of the fatalities occurred in Kerr County, where a riverside Christian girls' camp was deluged. Ten girls and a counsellor from Camp Mystic are still missing. More storms are expected in the next 24-48

cards.title: A girls' summer camp swept away by a 'horrific' deluge
cards.summary: Camp Mystic, a Christian girls' camp perched on the banks of the Guadalupe River in Texas, was a place of laughter, prayer and adventure just days ago. Just before daybreak on Friday, the river rose 26ft (8m) in about 45 minutes amid a torrential downpour. Many of the hundreds

cards.title: Trump calls Musk's new political party 'ridiculous'
cards.summary: Trump calls Musk's new political party 'ridiculous' Former close ally Elon Musk set up America Party to compete against Republican and Democratic parties. Musk and Trump were formerly close allies, with the Tesla boss leading the Department of Government Efficiency.

cards.title: IDF says it killed Hamas commander in cafe strike that killed dozens of civilians
cards.summary: IDF says it killed Hamas commander in cafe strike that killed dozens of civilians. IDF says Ramzi Ramadan Abd Ali Saleh was a "significant source of knowledge" within Hamas. IDF also said it had taken steps "to mitigate the risk of harming civilians"

cards.title: US deports eight men to South Sudan after legal battle
cards.summary: US deports eight men to South Sudan after legal battle. They were shackled by both hands and feet, guarded by US service members. Only one of the eight is from South Sudan. The rest are nationals of Myanmar, Cuba, Vietnam, Laos and Mexico.

cards.title: Thousands turn out to mark Dalai Lama's 90 birthday
cards.summary: Thousands turn out to mark Dalai Lama's 90th birthday celebrations. Thousands of Tibetan Buddhists streamed into India's Himalayan town of Dharamshala on Sunday. Ferocious monsoon rains did not dampen the spirits.

cards.title: Uganda's 80-year-old president in bid to extend 40-year rule
cards.summary: Yoweri Museveni, 80, has been declared the governing party's candidate in next year's presidential election. He has won every election held since he seized power as a rebel leader in 1986. Critics say he has ruled with an iron hand since 1986.

cards.title: Australian PM vows 'full force of law' after arson attack at synagogue
cards.summary: Australian PM vows 'full force of law' after arson attack at synagogue in Melbourne. Pictures showed a man pouring liquid on the synagogue's front door before setting it on fire. Some 20 people having dinner inside at the time were evacuated without any injuries. Police are also trying to determine if the incident is linked to an attack on

cards.title: How an al-Qaeda offshoot became one of Africa's deadliest militant groups
cards.summary: Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimin (JNIM) is the main group behind a surge in militant jihadist attacks sweeping across several West African nations. On 1 July, the group said it had carried out a major coordinated attack on seven military locations in western Mali, including near the borders with Senegal

cards.title: A video game on 'gold diggers' is fuelling a sexism debate in China
cards.summary: Revenge on Gold Diggers has fuelled a debate on sexism in China. Game's lead director, Hong Kong filmmaker Mark Hu, has been banned on several Chinese social media platforms. The game's creators insist they never intended to target women.

cards.title: Lena Dunham on fatphobia, dating advice and her new London rom-com
cards.summary: Lena Dunham's new London rom-com, Too Much, is based on her life over the last few years. The US actress, writer and director rose to fame with her award-winning series Girls. Dunham says there are some autobiographical elements to Too Much.

cards.title: Explosion rips through Domino's restaurant after car crashes into building
cards.summary: An explosion ripped through a Domino's Pizza restaurant in Utah on Saturday night. It came after a car veered off the road and crashed into the building, the local fire agency said.

cards.title: 'Y'all need to get out now' - Texans reflect on flood devastation
cards.summary: Flash floods swept through central Texas on 4 July killing at least 51 people and leaving 27 children among the missing. Texans shared their reactions to the extreme weather. One woman spoke from where she had been "swimming, having fun" the day prior.

cards.title: Richard Gere joins Dalai Lama's 90th birthday celebrations
cards.summary: Actor Richard Gere, a long-time follower, joined other devotees to honour the exiled leader. The hilltop temples echoed with chants, while dance troupes performed with clanging cymbals and bagpipes.
